intro: Xylopia sericea, commonly known as the silky xylopia, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, often hairy bark and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical, yellowish fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species in its native ecosystems, though it is not widely cultivated.
